content: The Act is titled the "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" and defines terms such as "Federal land" and "hazardous substance" in relation to the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The curr_chunk defines terms such as "remedy," "Henderson Redevelopment Agency," "map," and "Responsible Party" in relation to the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The curr_chunk defines terms related to the Three Kids Mine Project Site, including "map," "Responsible Party," "Secretary," "State," and the site itself. The Three Kids Mine Project Site encompasses approximately 1,262 acres of land, including Federal and adjacent non-Federal land depicted on a map. The land conveyance process must be completed within 90 days of meeting specified conditions. The Secretary will convey all right, title, and interest of the United States in the Federal land to the Henderson Redevelopment Agency within 90 days of meeting specified conditions. The Agency must pay the fair market value for the land as determined and adjusted accordingly. The Secretary will determine the fair market value of the Federal land through an appraisal conducted according to national standards. The Secretary will estimate the costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site, following national appraisal standards and not considering historical mining contamination on the Federal land. The Secretary will estimate costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site based on a Phase II environmental site assessment prepared in accordance with ASTM International Standard E-2137-06. Assessment requirements for Phase II environmental site assessment must comply with specified procedures. The Phase II environmental site assessment must adhere to ASTM International standards E-1527-05 and E-1903-11. The Secretary will consider cost information from the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, Responsible Party, and State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, parties will select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of enacting the Act. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimates of remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance of Federal land is contingent on the execution of a mine remediation and reclamation agreement, as determined by the Secretary within 30 days of receiving written notification from the State. The mine remediation and reclamation agreement required under subparagraph (A) must be an enforceable consent order or agreement between the State and the Responsible Party, obligating the Responsible Party to perform remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine after the conveyance of Federal land. The conveyance of Federal land under this Act includes remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances. Provisions determined necessary by the State and Henderson Redevelopment Agency, including financial assurance, will ensure completion of the remedy. SEC. 4. WITHDRAWAL. Subject to valid existing rights, for the 10-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act, the Federal land conveyed under this Act is withdrawn from all forms of entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws. SEC. 4. WITHDRAWAL. The Federal land is withdrawn for a 10-year period from entry, appropriation, operation, disposal under public land laws, mining laws, and mineral leasing laws. The Federal land is withdrawn for 10 years under public land laws, mining laws, and mineral leasing laws. Any withdrawal including land no longer needed by the Bureau of Reclamation is relinquished to allow for immediate conveyance. This Act does not affect existing Reclamation projects and facilities. SEC. 5. ACEC BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The Act does not diminish existing rights for operation, maintenance, and improvement of water conveyance infrastructure on Federal land. The boundary of the River is adjusted. SEC. 5. ACEC BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. SEC. 6. RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE PARTIES. Responsibility for mine remediation and reclamation agreement applies to Responsible Party and State of Nevada after conveyance completion. Responsibility for complying with the mine remediation and reclamation agreement falls on the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada. If the terms of the agreement are not met after conveyance, the Secretary retains the responsibility to take necessary actions to protect public health and the environment from hazardous substances. SEC. 7. SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT ACT does not apply to land conveyed under this Act.
